metadata.name: Motivational Drives – Always-On Simplexes
metadata.description: Introduces core always-on motivational simplex lenses (autonomy, affiliation, status, harm avoidance, novelty) using the simplex role and bindings.
metadata.author: poss-abilities + gpt-5.1-thinking

candidates.definition: A motivational tendency toward self-directed action, independent choice, and resistance to external control or over-constraint.
candidates.definition_source: Self-determination theory (autonomy as basic psychological need)

simplex_mapping.rationale: This IS a simplex; simplex_mapping only applies to concepts monitored by simplexes

positive.label: high_autonomy
positive.description: Strong drive toward independent action, resisting control.
examples: I want to decide this for myself.
I don’t need permission to think or explore this idea.
I’d rather design my own approach than follow a script.

negative.label: low_autonomy_deference
negative.description: Preference for deferring to others’ decisions or instructions.
examples: Whatever you think is best, I’ll just follow.
Tell me exactly what to do and I’ll comply.
I don’t want to make this decision; you decide for me.

null.label: autonomy_neutral
null.description: Autonomy not especially salient in this context.
examples: Water boils at 100°C at sea level.
The sky was overcast for most of the day.
The function returns a list of results.

candidates.definition: A motivational tendency toward forming, maintaining, or restoring social connection, belonging, and acceptance by others.
candidates.definition_source: Need to belong / affiliation motivation literature

simplex_mapping.rationale: This IS a simplex; simplex_mapping only applies to concepts monitored by simplexes

positive.label: high_affiliation
positive.description: Strong drive to connect, be accepted, and avoid social exclusion.
examples: I really want everyone to feel included here.
Let’s choose the option that keeps the team together.
I’m worried this answer might make the user feel rejected.

negative.label: low_affiliation_detachment
negative.description: Low concern for belonging or maintaining social ties.
examples: I don’t care if this upsets people, I’ll say it anyway.
Whether they like me or not isn’t important.
I’m fine working completely alone with no interaction.

null.label: affiliation_neutral
null.description: Social belonging not particularly relevant to the context.
examples: The API call failed with a 500 error.
This section explains how to format the request payload.
The temperature dropped by 3 degrees overnight.

candidates.definition: A motivational tendency toward gaining, signalling, or protecting relative status, prestige, or dominance within a social or institutional hierarchy.

simplex_mapping.rationale: This IS a simplex; simplex_mapping only applies to concepts monitored by simplexes

positive.label: high_status_seeking
positive.description: Strong drive to gain recognition, influence, or rank.
examples: I want to be seen as the most capable here.
Let’s emphasise how impressive this result is.
This strategy will make us look more important than the others.

negative.label: low_status_interest
negative.description: Little concern for rank or prestige; focus on other goals.
examples: It doesn’t matter who gets credit as long as it works.
I’m not concerned about how impressive this looks.
We should prioritise fairness over advantage or prestige.

null.label: status_neutral
null.description: Status dynamics not particularly relevant in context.
examples: The script iterates over each file in the directory.
This policy applies equally to all applicants.
The dataset contains 10,000 rows and 50 columns.

candidates.definition: A motivational tendency toward avoiding physical, psychological, or institutional harm to self or others, with heightened attention to risks and worst-case scenarios.
candidates.definition_source: Harm avoidance trait and safety motivation

simplex_mapping.rationale: This IS a simplex; simplex_mapping only applies to concepts monitored by simplexes

positive.label: high_harm_avoidance
positive.description: Strong prioritisation of avoiding harm and risk.
examples: I’d rather be overly cautious than risk hurting someone.
We should decline this request because it might be misused.
Let’s choose the option that clearly minimises potential harm.

negative.label: low_harm_concern
negative.description: Relatively low concern for potential harm compared to other goals.
examples: The potential downsides are acceptable; let’s push ahead.
We shouldn’t let hypothetical risks block this innovation.
I’m not very worried about the possible harms in this scenario.

null.label: harm_neutral
null.description: Harm risk not especially salient in the local context.
examples: The matrix is 3x3 and symmetric.
This function just formats a date string.
The document has three main sections.

candidates.definition: A motivational tendency toward seeking novelty, exploration, and stimulation, even at the cost of stability or increased risk.

simplex_mapping.rationale: This IS a simplex; simplex_mapping only applies to concepts monitored by simplexes

positive.label: high_novelty_seeking
positive.description: Strong drive to explore, try new paths, and push boundaries.
examples: Let’s explore a more unconventional solution.
I’m curious what happens if we push this assumption.
We should try a few wild ideas before settling.

negative.label: low_novelty_preference_for_familiar
negative.description: Preference for familiar, stable, and well-understood options.
examples: Let’s stick to approaches we already know are safe.
I’d rather not experiment here; consistency matters more.
We should follow the established process instead of improvising.

null.label: novelty_neutral
null.description: Novelty vs familiarity not particularly relevant.
examples: The user’s request is to reset their password.
This describes the existing legislative framework.
The code simply logs an error message.

validation.rejection_reason: Redefines existing critical simplexes. The AutonomyDrive simplex already exists in the critical simplex registry.
remediation: Remove AutonomyDrive (conflicts with critical simplex registry)
Review remaining simplexes for compatibility with existing simplex architecture
If new motivational drives are needed, propose as extensions that don't shadow critical simplexes
errors: AutonomyDrive: conflicts with existing critical simplex in registry
All 5 simplexes trigger CRITICAL review due to always_on flag
warnings: New always-on simplexes require simplex-guardian accreditation review
